Overview: REI Systems is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you will procure, decipher, and present data to our government clients to help them improve efficiency and effectiveness of their processes. Your contributions will make an impact on the critical missions of our government clients, solving challenges that aim to improve millions of lives across the globe. Responsibilities: Prepare data science business cases while working with domain experts and customers. Support defining the AI strategy within a federal government agency. Independently develops customized algorithms to solve analytical problems with incomplete data sets and implements automated processes for efficiently producing scale models. Independently conducts statistical modelling, machine learning modelling and experiment design, and tests and validates predictive models. Perform statistical analysis, data mining, temporal and pattern analysis, correlation of events, predictive modelling, and pattern recognition. Document and visualize analytics both temporally and spatially, and present analytic results and uncertainty to decision makers. Provide informational briefings to explain methodologies and analytical findings to peers and customer stakeholders. Investigate and implement new scientific analysis and methodologies to support big data analytics efforts and implement workflows, data models, indexes and templates and facilitate data movement on all associated systems and networks. Provide architecture analysis and design implementation with detailed technology roadmaps and transition planning and master plans as required. Finds and recommends new uses for existing data sources; designs, modifies, and builds new data processes; and builds large, complex data sets. Other similar professional duties maybe assigned as needed. Qualifications: 5 to 8 years of experience with programming languages (such as Python, R, Java, Ruby, Spark, or SQL), and statistical analytics (such as SAS, Matlab, R). 3 to 5 years of experience with machine learning and deep learning modelling (with packages such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.) Experience in analysis, processing, tagging, and indexing unstructured, semi-structured, and structured classified and unclassified data sets. Experience developing research designs, including formulating testable questions, identifying and defining key concepts and variables, and matching appropriate methods to problems Experience in data management, including cleaning and preparing data, and creating, structuring, and maintaining data sets Experience with incorporating data science capability into Stakeholder strategy Experience bridging data science strategy between leadership, IT, data scientists and other stakeholders. Good understanding of Databases, SQL, Hadoop, Hive and/or MapReduce AWS or Azure experience is prefrred PhD (preferred) or master’s in data science, Mathematics, Analytics, Statistics or related field will take precedence for interviews. Employer will accept a suitable combination of education, training or experience About REI Systems REI Systems has delivered innovative solutions that empower people and impact millions of lives since 1989. Our 500+ problem-solving technologists and consultants are passionate about modernizing the government to fulfill their missions more effectively. Our customers include Government Operations, Homeland Security, Health, Science, Financial Services, and State, Local, and Nonprofits. We take a Mindful Modernization approach in providing Application Modernization, Data Analytics, Grants Management, Small Business Innovation Research Programs, and Advisory Services. Delivering domain experts, management consultants, and best-fit technologies through agile execution, along with a commitment to customer service is the REI Way. REI Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer

job_title: Senior Bioinformatics Data Scientist II/ Staff Bioinformatics Data Scientist
job_Description: Description: Inscripta  was founded in 2015 and recently launched the world's first benchtop Digital Genome Engineering platform. The company is growing aggressively, investing in its leadership, team, and technology with a recent $150mm financing round led by Fidelity and T. Rowe Price. The company’s advanced CRISPR-based platform, consisting of an instrument, reagents, and software, offers a fully automated workflow that enables multiplexed, trackable editing of cells at an unprecedented scale. Inscripta’s mission is to enable scientists to realize the full potential of biology. Due to rapid growth and recent commercialization, Inscripta has an opening for a  Senior Bioinformatics Data Scientist II/ Staff Bioinformatics Data Scientist  located in  Boulder, CO or Pleasanton, CA or San Diego, CA or in the Remote U.S.. Summary: Our Computational Sciences and Engineering team works with diverse multi-disciplinary teams throughout Inscripta. Our team addresses a number of genomic, proteomic, experimental design, and other relevant questions using mathematical modeling, simulation, data science, machine learning, and other computationally challenging techniques. We are looking for exceptional candidates to build out our automated analytical pipelines, develop novel algorithms and models for genomics and proteomics, and create scalable platforms for large-scale computation. Responsibilities: Develop novel approaches for effectively generating and analyzing mammalian and microbial experimental data within Inscripta. Perform custom analyses of a wide range of data from instruments used in laboratory settings. Create and maintain automated analytical pipelines for next-gen sequencing data samples. Contribute to the design and verification of primers and oligonucleotide sequences. Contribute to the design of experiments and improvement of Inscripta products. Perform other work-related duties as assigned. . Requirements: A Bachelor’s degree in a technical or scientific area, such as computer science, engineering, biology, biochemistry, physics, or related fields. An advanced degree is strongly preferred. A minimum of 4 years of relevant experience (may include post-doctoral experience). For the Staff Bioinformatics Data Scientist level, candidates would need to have at least six years of relevant experience. Salary will be based on experience. Proficiency with statistical analysis and modeling of biological data. Experience with DNA/RNA sequencing data analysis. Experience working with mammalian genomics and single-cell sequencing is preferred. Strong problem solving, statistical, and mathematical skills. Experience working with large data sets consisting of 1000s of samples. Software development skills, including a working knowledge of version control systems, continuous integration processes, and Agile development techniques. Knowledge of Python, R, C++, Java, or other advanced languages. Python, R and C++ are strongly preferred. Strong communication and presentation skills. Familiarity with a broad range of bioinformatics software and algorithms. Special consideration given for experience with CRISPR-relevant methods such as guide RNA design, detection of precise edits and NHEJs, off-target prediction and detection. Inscripta  offers a competitive base salary, bonus plan, benefits package, 401k match, and an attractive equity program to all team members. Base Salary Range: $135,000 to $165,000 per year. Base salary range provided per current averages and expectations. The salary and job title for this opening will be based on the selected candidate's qualifications and experience and may be outside this range. Join us and work with a cutting edge organization creating cutting edge technology. At Inscripta, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, support it, and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our innovation, and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace because the more inclusive we are as a company, the better our work will be. Inscripta is headquartered in Boulder, CO with offices in Pleasanton and San Diego, CA.  This position can work out of either our Pleasanton, CA or San Diego, CA or Boulder, CO locations, or work remotely in the U.S..

iCatalyst, Inc. is an agile solution-oriented business and technology solutions company serving as a trusted partner and advisor to multiple federal and commercial customers since 2007. We are appraised at Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) ML3 in Software Development and our systems are International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 9001:2015 (Quality Management) and ISO 27001:2013 (Information Security) certified. Our expertise and primary support is in areas of Program Management, Software Development, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Enterprise Architecture, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence, and Cyber Security. We have an exciting opportunity for a seasoned  Data Scientist  to join our program team.  We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, short-term disability insurance, life insurance, free Uber rides, and phone reimbursement. Other benefits include 401k, paid government holidays, training, education assistance, wellness benefit, and personal leave.  Job Responsibilities The successful candidate will use their enthusiasm and apply strong data science knowledge to assist the Program Manager on the following: Define key metrics and develop an approach for capturing data on an on-going basis. Research technical developments, services, and applications that can be applied to solve customers’ needs by utilizing regular expressions and machine learning models to automate parsing of large data sets. Employing natural language processing and machine learning techniques to quickly identify relevant information in large corpus of text and tuning query methods to speed the identification and visualization of search results. Integrates and extracts relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data (internal and external) to enable analytic solutions. Conduct advanced analytics leveraging data modeling, machine learning, simulation, optimization and other techniques to deliver insights or develop analytic solutions to achieve business objectives. Support PM on efforts to develop scalable, efficient, automated solutions for large-scale data analysis, model development, model validation, and model implementation. Develop algorithms and complex code such that research efforts are based on the highest quality data. Translate complex analytical and technical concepts to non-technical employees to enable understanding and drive informed business decisions. Brief internal and external stakeholders on technical progress, risks, and alternative courses of action through mediums such as presentations, documentations, and discussions. Assist in technical writing including proposal support. Undertake special projects as required. Required Skills Expertise in developing queries and code in SPARQL, SQL, Java, and Python. Knowledge in Machine learning and other predictive analytic techniques to include natural language processing, clustering, decision trees, and association. Knowledge in rendering tools such as Power BI, Altryx or Tableau to include predictive analytics. Knowledge of data analysis and industry data sources. Knowledge of, and ability to work with both waterfall and agile methodologies. Experience providing oversight and working with a product development group. Experience working with a team with a consistent focus on accountability, delivery, and the customer experience. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Must be able to work independently with the key stakeholders. Strong planning and organizing skills. Ability to prioritize and work effectively towards deadlines. Attention to detail and accuracy. Flexibility-Multi-task adaptability. Ability to interact with a variety of individuals in a courteous and professional manner. Experience/Qualifications 5+ years of relevant experience. Experience supporting multiple projects. Education Position requires BS/BA in a STEM discipline from an accredited university with 5 years of experience OR a MS/MA degree in a STEM discipline with 3 years of experience Location Washington, DC or remote Position Type/Hours Full Time Salaried Exempt Contract/Customer Federal Customer Compensation Pay and benefits information for this position will be provided to interested candidates that apply Travel N/A Clearance Ability to obtain and maintain a 5C Public Trust Clearance Other US Citizenship Required For more Information, Please visit: iCatalyst Careers Page iCatalyst Website

Overview  We are conducting a search for a Principal Data Scientist to join our client’s AI team in Palo Alto, CA or remotely anywhere in the United States.  Are you a seasoned team leader with a passion for applying data science to challenging real world applications? Do you have an appetite for healthcare applications of AI?  Come join our client’s world-class project delivering AI-powered diagnostics and therapeutics to dramatically improve the outlook of young children with cognitive and behavioral conditions.  Our client’s AI department is looking to make a key hire to contribute to ongoing research and improvement of AI-assisted child behavioral diagnostics and therapeutics. Their cutting edge algorithms use ML predictive modeling, as well as DL computer vision and computer audio analysis to streamline the diagnosis and therapy of conditions like Autism, ADHD, and speech and language disorders for pre-school children.  They are looking for an experienced scientist with a proven track record in taking ML and DL algorithms from concept to production. Past experience in clinical science and/or AI assisted diagnostics a big plus.  Qualifications (Must Haves)  3+ years proven track record of successfully applying DL-based computer vision or computer audio modeling to real world problems  5+ years proven track record of successfully applying ML predictive modeling to real world problems  Passion to crack difficult problems with relentless resourcefulness and the audacity to experiment with unorthodox solutions  Thirst for learning and eagerness to share learnings with team members and guide the overall team trajectory to success  Solid foundational education in each of: Machine Learning, Statistical analysis, and Deep Learning / Computer vision  If interested, please send your resume to lana@bxgi.com

NLP Data Scientist    Summary:  ReviewTrackers is currently looking for a passionate, self-motivated, and collaborative NLP Data Scientist to join our Product and Engineering Team. Our Data Scientist will be working on our sentiment analysis and KW extraction models as well as creating new ones as we continue to grow our product. This position has the opportunity to grow into a team leadership role as the team expands in 2022.   What you will be working on:  Cutting-edge products that involve natural language processing and business intelligence analysis Collaborating with coworkers to solve new technical problems   Who you will be working with:  You will be reporting to the VP of Engineering, and will be meeting weekly to develop a clear and defined promotional path. You will be working in our Engineering organization of about 20 Engineers, on a team with 3 Engineers, a Product Manager, and a Product Designer. You will be cross collaborating with the product team to create data-driven solutions. You will be working with the product team to POC product ideas collected from all ReviewTrackers employees, including engineering,   What you bring to the table:  3-5+ years experience using Python for large scale data processing and analysis Proven experience building NLP products at a startup with an engaged customer base Experience researching and implementing latest scientific literature on NLP and ML Experience building prototypes and experiments to validate technical ideas Extensive knowledge of open source NLP libraries including Pytorch 3-5+ years experience with SQL Strong communication skills with the ability to break down complex ideas to a non-technical audience Experience working within an Agile Software Engineering team and working directly with Product Management team (nice to have)   Perks and Benefits at ReviewTrackers:  Working FULLY Remote! 100% company-paid premiums for health, dental, vision, life, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance. BlueCross BlueShield healthcare benefits are available for families. Flexible PTO policy. Company-sponsored 401K matching at 3%. FSA or HSA benefits are available. Pre-taxed transit benefits. Diversity & Inclusion Culture Group and company-wide training(s). Volunteer & Fundraising initiatives. Monthly All-Hands meeting with all ReviewTrackers departments to discuss what each team is working on and reiterate its mission. Company Kindle, along with unlimited books of your choice. Regular team and company social events. Employee recognition program. Monthly ‘Take Your Coworker to Lunch’ paid for by ReviewTrackers $1,500 per year education budget.   About Us:  As a software company, ReviewTrackers empowers businesses to better understand their customers through advanced reviews and customer feedback technology. Our platform aggregates our customer’s reviews allowing them to analyze, amplify, and maximize customer feedback to accelerate customer acquisition and improve customer retention while driving more authentic connections. Please check us out at https://www.reviewtrackers.com.  At ReviewTrackers, we cultivate an inclusive, equitable, dynamic, and communicative team environment. We value crafting a team with diverse backgrounds and mindsets while respecting a healthy expression of opinions. We support and inspire our team to experiment with new ideas while collaborating and communicating with one another to find creative solutions.  ReviewTrackers provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Join us as we revolutionize the hospital pharmacy landscape! Our mission is to wow customers with smart, elegant solutions that help healthcare providers increase efficiency, safety and visibility from manufacturer to bedside. Our 'vibe' is start-up, but we already have over 700 customers who are tracking medications using our proven solutions. If you have a knack for making complex things simple and an interest in the practical application of artificial intelligence and IoT technologies, we have a place for you! We’re looking for a Data Analyst to support the implementation of Bluesight for Controlled Substances, our drug diversion software, to hospital systems. This person collects data, synthesizes and interprets results from a variety of disparate systems. The role will be responsible for finding and interpreting pertinent data points from both internal and external healthcare database source systems and developing analytical solutions using various business intelligence tools.  Duties & Responsibilities Verify and analyze data input from disparate systems Perform reconciliation and quality assurance of client data through the use of analytical and audit procedures to ensure data integrity Perform data extraction tasks using multiple databases and reporting tools Measure historical performance and apply learnings to forecast future data Develop solutions to support the automation of ongoing reporting and analytical needs Collaborate with the implementation and engineering team to identify trends and process improvement opportunities through data Acquire and retrieve data as necessary, provides for timely updates and assists in design and ease of use of the data for the end user Work closely with the implementation project lead and the customer to track progress, provide timely updates, and review data points Work cross functionally with software team to build data pipeline infrastructure Other duties as assigned  Qualifications & Skills Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience 3+ years of experience in data analysis, experience in the healthcare industry a plus Experience in Microsoft Office Suite, with deep expertise in Microsoft Excel Exceptional attention to detail Ability to present results to both non-technical and technical audiences Ability to manage multiple projects across varying timelines Nice to Have Experience in Python, R, or Ruby or other scripting language Knowledge of hospital data systems (e.g. EHR, ADS, purchasing reports, etc.) Experience working with PHI or other sensitive data  This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States. Why Kit Check? We truly believe that where you work matters and we want happy employees. So join us on our mission – we intend to have a heck of a good time as we get there. Competitive salary Time off when you need it – unlimited vacation days! Generous insurance coverage 401k program with a company match Employee stock options Fun, collaborative culture! Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled

Overview: Imagine transforming big data into business strategy for a Fortune 200 company with some of the most iconic brands! Interested in using your analytics expertise to influence our dynamic sales organization and help craft our future? Have a Bachelors degree with five years of work experience? If so, we want to speak with you! We are currently recruiting for a  Lead Data Scientist  for our Advanced Analytics department  Richmond, VA , or we are open to  remote work  arrangements. What you'll be doing:  Using big data sources to design, test and implement new analytical solutions to effectively influence and measure business outcomes Owning the application of advanced analytical methods (e.g. Bayesian and other advanced statistical models) to develop consumer centric insights Synthesis and communication of complex analyses to inform and influence business leaders Collaborating with diverse partner groups to deliver data solutions against multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment Fusing technical knowledge with business strategy to translate complex methods into impactful solutions What we want you to have:  Bachelors Degree in Decision Science, Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics or related field 5+ years of work experience in the data analytics space; CPG experience a plus Ability to conduct complex analyses and synthesize results independently Experience with SQL and Python programming languages; familiarity with Apache Spark & Databricks preferred Firm grasp of basic statistical/economic principles and experience in advanced statistical techniques Experience in hierarchical models and Bayesian statistics a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate abstract technical concepts with non-technical audiences A sense of urgency and curiosity, and the courage and confidence to debate across all levels of the organization In addition to the opportunity to apply and develop your skills toward key business objectives, we offer an excellent compensation package including a competitive base salary, comprehensive health/vision/dental insurance, participation in our deferred profit sharing and incentive compensation programs as well as a relocation assistance package. Company Overview: Altria has a leading portfolio of tobacco products for U.S. tobacco consumers age 21+. Altria’s Vision through 2030 is to responsibly lead the transition of adult smokers to a non-combustible future. Altria is Moving Beyond Smoking™, leading the way in moving adult smokers away from cigarettes by taking action to transition millions to potentially less harmful choices - believing it is a substantial opportunity for adult tobacco consumers, Altria’s businesses and society. Altria’s wholly owned subsidiaries include the most profitable tobacco companies in their categories: Philip Morris USA Inc. (PM USA), U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company LLC (USSTC), and John Middleton Co. (Middleton). Altria’s smoke-free portfolio includes Helix Innovations LLC (Helix), the maker of on! oral nicotine pouches, exclusive U.S. commercialization rights to the IQOS Tobacco Heating System® and Marlboro HeatSticks®, and an equity investment in JUUL Labs, Inc. (JUUL). Altria complements its tobacco portfolio with ownership of Ste. Michelle Wine Estates (Ste. Michelle) and equity investments in Anheuser-Busch InBev SA/NV (ABI), the world’s largest brewer, and Cronos Group Inc. (Cronos), a leading Canadian cannabinoid company. At Altria, we celebrate the power of diverse teams working together to shape our future. We are inspired to bring our best because our unique strengths are valued. We believe our personal success and progress should be guided by Our Cultural Aspiration, a new articulation of what we value and who we aspire to be, collectively. Our Cultural Aspiration respects and complements individual identity, embracing each other’s unique strengths, welcoming newcomers and developing the best, most inclusive and diverse teams. Join us as we work together to shape a better future for adult tobacco consumers, our employees, and our shareholders. Each Altria company is an equal opportunity employer. DISQO is changing the way that the world’s largest brands, agencies and consumer intelligence companies get to know their consumers. We’ve built the first identity-based platform that combines consumer attitudes and behaviors together to power the most accurate and predictive insights solutions for our customers, and we do all of that with the willing participation of our consumers and without using outdated technologies like third-party cookies. We help our customers get a cross-platform view into consumer sentiment, measure advertising effectiveness, analyze consumer purchase journeys, and ultimately grow their brands. Our mission at DISQO is to engage people to share their opinions and behaviors openly to help our customers make the right decisions. With over one million active members sharing their attitudes and behaviors, DISQO is looking to expand, improve and create world-class applications for people to openly share their data for research. Check out the DISQO Developer Blog for the latest from our DISQOTECH team. We are looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to join our Data Science and Analytics team to innovate and build data products. Some of the problems you will be heavily involved in are in the areas of survey matching optimization algorithms, identity fraud prevention, ad lift measurement, multi-touch attribution, propensity modeling and user segmentation. We are more than a traditional Data Science team. We are a high-performance team looking for others to challenge us to become even better. We are equal partners collaborating with product and engineering, finance and marketing teams to define and shape DISQO products and infuse them with Data Science capabilities at the consumer and enterprise side. We are looking for people with a growth mindset, data curiosity, who are comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty and have the eagerness to be agile, creative to redefine the market research space. What you will do:  You will be part of DISQO’s fast growing Data Science and Analytics team focusing on building data science models, products and solutions in the areas of fraud detection, recommendation engine, ad measurement, causal inference, reinforcement learning to understand consumer needs and derive insights based on behavior and attitudinal data. You will build data science models and products from requirements gathering, and exploratory data analysis to model development, test and evaluation to production deployment and maintenance You will derive insights and create new data science capabilities to help improve and advance DISQO’s consumer and enterprise facing products. You will work using the latest technologies, having access to a large volume of customer data in a data centric company. Incorporate results, learnings from A/B tests and feedback from existing models to improve the efficiency and performance of future models. Present your work and results and influence a wide range of audience – including management and marketing leaders, other Data Scientists and product managers. Guide and mentor junior data scientists. What you bring to the table:  PhD or Master in Computer Science, Mathematics, Neuroscience, Computational Biology, Econometrics Practical Data Science experience with a deep technical background in supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods, with a +3 years work experience Strong communicator - able to advocate data informed decision-making at all levels Strong analytical capabilities to translate business problems into Data Science problem formulations Experience with statistical and propensity modeling and time series prediction Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, AWS Athena, Hadoop, Redshift Familiar with A/B testing and evaluation methodologies. Expertise in SQL and programming in Python or R Nice to have Experience in the Ad Measurement and/or Market Research space Understanding of (and ideally practical experience with) concepts such as causal inference, reinforcement learning and multi-touch attribution Optimization / Operational research experience #dice * Perks & Benefits: * * 100% covered Medical/Dental/Vision for employee, 80% for dependents Equity Unlimited Vacation Flexible work hours Catered lunches 3x a week Stocked pantry Happy Hours Onsite Fitness Program Discounted Gym Membership Quarterly Offsites 401K Life Insurance FSA Paid Maternity/Paternity leave Disability Insurance Travel Assistance Program 24/7 Counseling Services offered to employees * DISQO is an equal opportunity employer. Discovery, innovation, and growth are possible when we open ourselves to new possibilities, perspectives, and approaches. That’s why, at DISQO, we welcome, support, and empower individuals from diverse backgrounds. Exceptional teams are rooted in extraordinary people, each with a unique story and a compelling set of skills. DISQO does not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.* * Recruiting firms that submit resumes to DISQO without first entering into a written contract will not be entitled to any compensation on candidates referred by that firm. National Polling and Market Research firm seeks  Data Science Associate . EMC Research, Inc. is a majority women-owned national full-service opinion research firm specializing in polling, focus groups, analytics and public opinion research consulting. Our mission is: to partner with our clients to solve problems through well-executed research conducted by curious and passionate strategists who explore opinion and behavior with empirical rigor; and to foster a collaborative environment for our employees to contribute, learn, and grow by valuing people above profits. Our clients include political campaigns, government agencies, corporations, nonprofits, transportation agencies, health care organizations, and others. Data Science Associate We are currently seeking a Data Science Associate to perform predictive modeling and machine learning analyses, as well as other advanced statistical analyses in support of quantitative research projects. The Data Science Associate will use R to clean, mine, and assess large datasets in order to apply machine learning and other data science techniques, create static and dynamic visualizations of data, and perform other analyses as need to answer pertinent research questions. This full-time hourly position provides a flexible schedule that includes some evening and weekend hours. The position is open to all applicants in the U.S. EMC Research has offices in Columbus, OH; Irving, TX; Oakland, CA; Portland, OR; Seattle, WA; and Washington, D.C. Temporarily during the pandemic, all operations are remote; and as a company we are still exploring what the future of our presence in specific office locations might look like. The position requires a strong statistical and coding background, experience using and deploying machine learning models, and a desire to experiment with new technologies and data collection approaches. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, inquisitive, data-focused problem solver who is interested in social behavior, public opinion and public policy; is comfortable communicating in a team environment; and can thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. EMC Research offers competitive salaries and generous benefits, overtime pay for hourly positions when required, and a highly collaborative, casual and fun work environment. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in a quantitative field; or 3-4 years experience in quantitative role Experience managing and cleaning data, solving analytical problems, and answering research questions using a programming language such as R or Python Experience building, validating, and applying machine learning methods to real world problems and the ability to articulate strengths, weakness, and differences between different models and paradigms Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts and experience with their applications Excellent written and verbal communication skills; comfortable articulating insights from data High level of attention to detail, self-motivated, proactive, and willingness to learn Eagerness to wear multiple hats and lend a hand to your colleagues Ability to work without direct supervision and operate in a team structure A desire to work with survey, voter, and commercial data and work in the public opinion research field Additional Desired Qualifications: Successful applicants will have additional strengths in some of the following.  Strong data visualization, data wrangling, and/or data mining skills using R Experience using SQL Familiarity with R Markdown, LaTeX, and/or Jupyter Experience using GIS software, including ArcMap and/or QGIS Experience building and maintaining web applications, namely R Shiny dashboards Familiarity with distributed data/computing software, such as Apache Spark and Hadoop Prior exposure to AWS and/or Azure Experience with web scraping and/or using APIs Familiarity with natural language processing EMC Research, Inc., is committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and a certified women-owned business. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, including people of color, women, LGBTQIA+ individuals, immigrants, veterans and persons with disabilities. If you are unsure if you meet the qualifications for this role but are still interested, you are encouraged to apply. To apply, please send your resume and cover letter with the subject line “Data Science Associate position” to resume@emcresearch.com. We thank you for your interest, but only those selected for interviews will be contacted. No additional inquiries by email, phone, or in person please. Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis.  LjuMsG6eMm

job_title: Data Scientist (Manager 180, 2 Vacancies) – Office of Institutional Research
job_Description: Join a vibrant campus community whose excellence is reflected in its diversity and student success. West Chester University of Pennsylvania’s Office of Institutional Research invites applicants for the position of Data Scientist. West Chester University, a member of the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education, is a public, comprehensive institution committed to offering high-quality undergraduate education, selected post-baccalaureate and graduate programs, and a variety of educational and cultural resources for its students, alumni, and citizens of southeastern Pennsylvania. The University offers more than 100 graduate and undergraduate programs in the sciences and mathematics, business and public management, arts and humanities, health sciences, education and social work, music, and interdisciplinary studies.  WCU is a community of educators dedicated to developing graduates who succeed personally and professionally and contribute to the common good. WCU proudly offers a positive and purposeful work environment; comprehensive employee benefits including health, vision, and dental insurance along with many wellness programs; a commitment to work-life balance including generous paid vacation, paid sick time, military leave and paid time off for most major holidays; and a University mission to support employee personal and professional growth including a tuition waiver for self and family members, training and development, and advancement opportunities. Under the supervision of the Director, Quantitative Analysis and Decision Support, the Data Scientist will support University administration and decision-making using data to improve University and student outcomes. This position will develop and maintain complex datasets used by OIR for reporting and analyses; develop and maintain dashboards and curated datasets for internal operational use; provide research design, survey design, and advanced statistical analyses used by campus constituents for assessment purposes; and develop statistical models used for risk scoring and predicting student behavior. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a deep understanding of advanced statistical techniques and concepts, including properties of distributions, regression, statistical tests, and proper usage and excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to share data and research results in ways that are easily consumed by non-statisticians. Responsibilities Include: Designing and implementing research projects, including developing queries to obtain needed data from the student information system or developing survey instruments, performing appropriate statistical analyses, documenting, and presenting results, in collaboration with the Director, Associate Vice President or other administrators or faculty. Designing and implementing risk scoring models to predict which students are at risk of not being retained. Performing appropriate statistical testing to determine program effectiveness. Developing and maintaining dashboards, data visualization, and reports critical to campus operational needs, assessment, and strategic planning. Communicating and providing technical support to a variety of faculty and staff, including developing and providing dashboard training. Responding to internal and external ad hoc requests; develop queries to obtain data needed for reporting and analysis; interpret complex data arrays and the trends they evidence in support of university policies and decisions; and make recommendations based on data results. Analyzing data and reports results from large internal and external survey research projects. Supporting the director and research analysts when needed. Enhancing professional development skills to ensure current institutional research practices are known and used and technical/statistical skills are up to date.  Minimum Qualifications  MS in Statistics, Data Science, or other Quantitative field (MS candidates will be considered)  OR  BS in Statistics, Data Science, or other quantitative field with one (1) year of  work experience with complex data management and statistical analyses. Technical experience with statistical software tools, both GUI and code based, to perform descriptive and inferential statistics (including predictive modeling, risk scoring, hypothesis testing) and to create reports and data visualizations. Experience with logistic regression, risk scoring, decision trees, factor analysis and GLM. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word, and Outlook  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with SAS Enterprise Miner, SAS Visual Analytics, and SAS Visual Statistics or other data Visual Analytics and Visual Statistics software. Experience with big data, data architecture, and data management in an enterprise relational database and data warehouse environment. Experience with PeopleSoft Student Information System (or similar relational databases) and code-based query tools, SQL preferred. Experience with survey platform like Qualtrics Experience with SharePoint. Experience with Microsoft Access Experience in higher education research.  Special Instructions  The salary range for this position is $66,358-$75,837. Ask about opportunities to work from home and alternate work schedules. Candidates should apply online at https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/wcupa. Electronic application allows for cover letter and resume (Both required for consideration). Examples of work products and a skills test will be required for candidates reaching the interview stage. Review of applications will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled. Applicants must successfully complete the interview process to be considered as a finalist. Developing and sustaining a diverse faculty and staff advances WCU’s educational mission and strategic Plan for Excellence. West Chester University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Women, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. All offers of employment are subject to and contingent upon satisfactory completion of all pre-employment background checks.

Title- Data Scientist Location- 100% Remote On W2  Status- Must be GC, EAD-GC or US Citizen This candidate can come from a variety of environments and as long as they are a strong Data Scientist with solid Python skills we should be good. Must Haves:  Solid Spark programming skills (PySpark/SparkR) MLflow Python/R Nice to have:  Databricks experience Dataiku experience Portfolio of healthcare-related data analysis Job Type: Full-time Pay: $60.00 - $70.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Master's (Preferred) Experience: Python R: 5 years (Preferred) ML Flow: 3 years (Preferred) Data Scientist: 8 years (Required) Work Location: Remote

At Getaround, we’re building a global platform to enable a future where all cars are shared. There are more than 1 billion cars in the world, and they are parked more than 95% of the time on average. With instant and keyless car sharing via our patented hardware and software platform and our industry-leading mobile apps, we’re helping communities around the world share these underutilized resources to reduce their vehicle footprint while providing mobility solutions. We aim to change the landscape of cities worldwide and make them better, more sustainable places to live. Getaround is looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help the organization make decisions that better serve our users and the marketplace. You will have the opportunity to lead foundation work in marketplace dynamics, experimentation, pricing, claims, fraud, customer analytics, and more. More than building ML models, this role will require finding creative ways to quantitatively frame complex problems in a multi-sided marketplace on different timescales. You will work closely with our Product, Engineering, Growth, Marketing, Operations, Claims, and Business Intelligence teams to help discover new opportunities, define the product roadmap, and drive strategic initiatives.  The team is based in San Francisco and we are fully remote. What you'll be doing:  Forecast the two-sided marketplace and model its dynamics to optimize pricing and growth strategy, while working closely with Operations and Claims/Actuarial teams Contribute to design of an experimentation platform including tools, processes, and best practices for causal inference and actionable interpretation Analyze marketplace participants to identify usage patterns and anomalous behavior to understand how and why people use our product Distill complex data and findings into understandable narratives, communicate with cross-functional stakeholders and make actionable recommendations Find opportunities to improve product efficiency and revenue performance, limit unwanted behavior through predictive and prescriptive analytics What you'll need:  5+ years experience in a role focused on applied statistics, data science or econometric modeling with a degree in related quantitative field Expertise in R or Python for statistical analysis and building machine learning models Expertise in using SQL for data extraction and transformation Experience in building predictive models for pricing, forecasting, or recommendation Experience in product experimentation and causal inference High level of attention to detail, ability to give detailed feedback on complex quantitative projects, a drive for comprehensive understanding and an unwillingness to accept conventional wisdom at face value Strong presentation and written communication skills with the ability to build consensus with multi level cross-functional stakeholders Additional Awesomeness:  Experience with any part of our data stack: Airflow, BigQuery, dbt, Looker, and git would be helpful, but not a requirement Benefits and Perks:  Platinum plans for medical, dental, and vision to take excellent care of you and your family Generous Stock Options and robust 401(K) to help you save and plan for retirement Remote First Workplace, flexible work hours, and UNLIMITED PTO (we mean it!) Work smarter incentive policy to optimize your home office and individual wellness needs Education stipend to promote your career development and growth Udemy for business learning portal Monthly Getaround credits and discounts for your friends and family #LI-Remote At Getaround, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no matter your race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, _your perspective has value. _ Come join us in continuing to make Getaround a great place to work! Job Type: Full-time

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. Lonza is seeking an experienced and motivated Associate Principal Scientist with a strong background in cheminformatics and data science to join the Small Molecules R&D team. He/She/They will broaden and deepen the Division’s capabilities in the development and application of R&D cheminformatics, with a focus on Preclinical CMC workflows. This role is integral to R&D’s mission to develop innovative technology platforms that accelerate the clinical readiness of our clients’ groundbreaking therapeutics. Our new colleague will be responsible for developing innovations in a broad range of cheminformatics areas, including – as non-limiting examples – complex molecule synthesis, reaction and process optimization, automation integration, and HTE experimentation and large scale data analysis. Key responsibilities: Leverages data search, retrieval, and modelling to accelerate CMC workflows, working collaboratively with Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) R&D and Operations colleagues. Collaborates with technical and commercial stakeholders to uncover, validate, and prioritize areas for innovation in cheminformatics and data science Integrates information from a variety of disciplines (chemical synthesis and manufacturing; pharmaceutical sciences, opportunistically) and sources (technical and commercial) to uncover actionable insights and new Lonza IP. Leads technical and commercial stakeholders to data-driven decisions on the selection and internal use of state-of-the-art cheminformatics technologies, including augmentation of off-the-shelf cheminformatics solutions Develops methods and capabilities for archiving and retrieving data on molecular structures, reaction pathways, molecular interactions, and other pharmaceutically relevant phenomena. Identifies chemical property classifications and trends from large databases using mathematical and cheminformatics techniques. Trains and advises DS and DP R&D and Operations colleagues about the cheminformatics capabilities available to them – those newly developed in R&D and pre-existing. Promotes the benefits of Small Molecules’ cheminformatics and data science advances through publications (patents, peer-reviewed journal articles, technical marketing communications) and public speaking engagements (conference presentations, poster sessions, roundtables, etc.) Key requirements: PhD in Organic Chemistry, Cheminformatics, Computational Chemistry, or related scientific field with significant experience within pharmaceutical, fine chemicals, or biotechnology field.  -OR-  MS/MA in Organic Chemistry  and  MS Cheminformatics or MS Computational Science with significant years of experience within pharmaceutical, fine chemicals, or biotechnology field.  Candidates with combined experience in laboratory research settings (organic synthesis or method development) and cheminformatics or data science are strongly encouraged to apply. Experience Demonstrated cheminformatics expertise in areas such as applied AI and machine learning, chemical reaction/library enumeration, 2D/3D similarity, clustering, text-mining, dimensionality reduction techniques pertinent to data mining and data visualizations – with proven track record of accomplishments Strong fluency in at least one scientific scripting or programming language (e.g., R or Python) and at least one querying language (e.g., SQL) Proficiency with cheminformatics pipelining tools (e.g., KNIME) and leveraging toolkits, therein (e.g., RDKit, CDK, Erlwood, etc.) and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, DeepChem) Demonstrated understanding of critical assessment of molecule-property data, reaction process data, and predictive model quality. Essential skills Passion_ You love to draw unique insights in organic synthesis, process chemistry, and material science through the combination, normalization, and analysis of disparate data Entrepreneurial mindset_ You thrive on defining key challenges, innovative solutions,  and  the commercial benefits of research investments, to grow the company and team Great communication and presentations skills_ You enjoy telling stories with data, internally and externally. (Language proficiency in English and Deutsch.) Roll-up-your-sleeves Leadership_ You are happy to teach by demonstration as needed, and to individually contribute to achieve project success. Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference. Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst, Testing and Optimization
job_Description: At Glowforge, we help people bring home the future and make it their own. Our printer uses a laser to carve and engrave products from raw materials like wood, leather, acrylic – even cardboard. Take a look and see for yourself. We build magical products to delight our customers, and we do it while taking care of each other. We hire people who are outstanding at what they do, who thrive in tight-knit teams, and who want to make things that make a difference. Together, we've built a product we're incredibly proud of, and the reward has been incredible growth. We work together because we believe in the power of creativity. We believe we can bring about a future where anyone can print anything. We'd love to have you join us. We're a remote-first company - just let us know where you prefer to work from! Why we need you Here at Glowforge, we have an amazing product we’re anxious to tell the world about. We also have a passionate crew of smart people with loads of ideas and a few strong opinions on how to do just that! We need someone to help us build a framework and infrastructure for testing that helps us prioritize the best tests, minimize the time between ideation and execution, and come away with clear insights on what’s working and why. We need someone who can make us love the process, not just the results! We know you can help us focus on the right ideas and to help more people than ever discover their inner creator." Here’s what you’ll be doing Everyone wants to let data lead the way, but testing still feels like an afterthought. You’ll draw on your past experience to build a robust testing program for the Glowforge Growth and Sales teams, that engages and energizes partners to encourage full participation. You’ll introduce best practices to ensure that we’re properly defining our hypotheses, building rock solid testing plans, measuring accurately, and building on what we learn to constantly improve our game. More specifically, you’ll:  Own the testing roadmap, ensuring cross-functional alignment to overall business objectives and a rigorous testing schedule. Leverage data to identify behaviors, trends and insights that can be used for future testing, targeting and personalization. Work with stakeholders to identify key business questions, develop hypotheses, then define and prioritize the tests. Translate test results into meaningful insights and socialize findings across the team to maximize benefit. You need these qualifications Excellent analytics skills used to decompose complex questions into key components then identify appropriate metrics and mechanisms for gaining actionable insights on them. Strong background in digital test design and measurement to ensure well-crafted, meaningful tests that inspire confidence in their results. Excellent written and verbal communication skills to help Strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize effectively Proficiency with digital marketing and analytics platforms, like Google Analytics, Adwords, Facebook. Extensive experience with digital testing platforms like Adobe Target, Google Optimize, or Optimizely. It would be nice if… You have knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You have startup experience You are personally passionate for what we’re building - and can’t wait to get a Glowforge of your own. Equal opportunity employment There's one more, very important thing. We are an equal opportunity employer. We search for amazing people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We take care of each other to create an inclusive work environment where we love to come to work every day. We'd be happy to provide reasonable accommodations to help you apply - just email us at jobs@glowforge.com. We hope you can join us. Job Type: Full-time

UnitedHealth Group is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing  your life's best work.(sm)  Optum Labs serves as United Health Group’s innovation and advanced product hub. Our team conducts cutting-edge research in the health care space and incubates data-driven digital solutions which aim to improve patients’ health outcomes, clinicians’ experience, and reduce health care costs. Our teams leverage clinical expertise, applied research and advanced data analytics technologies such as AI and Machine Learning to enhance business products and specific services. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities: Develop novel machine learning algorithms for prediction of health outcomes and improved care Implement machine learning algorithms from the literature and evaluate their performance Develop machine learning across different data domains (e.g., images, unstructured data, genomics), and across different machine learning domains Communicate the performance of the machine learning algorithms across an interdisciplinary team Write both internal and external documentation of the novel algorithms, including publications in machine learning and other scientific conferences and journals  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications: Bachelors degree in machine learning, computer science, statistics, biomedical informatics, or a related field 2+ years of experience working on hands-on machine learning algorithms Hands-on experience in implementing and training machine learning algorithms and statistical analysis, including for example non-parametric tests, mixed linear models, modern supervised and unsupervised machine learning algortithms such as SVM, random forest, PCA, t-SNE, clustering, and neural networks Understanding of mathematical foundations of machine learning, including statistics, linear algebra, or computer science Programming competence demonstrated in at least one or more of these programming languages: Python, R, Java, C++, Matlab Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance.  Preferred Qualifications: Solid communication skills, including in an interdisciplinary environment Solid written communication skills of scientific material Knowledge and experience working with genomic data, wearables, or with medical records data Software tool development experience: source control (git), packaging, documentation Demonstrated ability to work in a team Demonstrated track record of scientific publications in machine learning or a related field Work on health related fields (e.g., biomedical informatics, bioinformatics, biomathematics) is an advantage Experience working in an interdisciplinary environment, particularly across engineering and medicine Experience with cloud computing Experience communicating with and briefing senior executives Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative and fluid work environment  UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers at UnitedHealth Group.  We have modest goals: Improve the lives of others. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 5 company. We provide an environment where you're empowered to be your best. We encourage you to take risks. And we offer a world of rewards and benefits for performance. We believe the most important is the opportunity to do  your life's best work.(sm) *All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Machine Learning, Machine Learning Scientist, Researcher Academics, Genomics, Healthcare, Telecommute, Telecommuter, Telecommuting, Work at Home, Work from Home, Remote

Our mission is to exceptionally deliver relevant and valuable information solutions to the Business Aviation, Air Carrier, Rotary Wing, UAS, and the overall Aerospace marketplace.** ARGUS  is currently seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join our team. This position will report to our Denver, CO location and can be 100% remote. Our platform is used by companies in the private aviation industry to gain insight into real time flight activity, to analyse industry trends, to find opportunities to expand market share, and to assess operational performance against industry benchmarks. This position is a key member of the ARGUS engineering team responsible for the Argus data platform. In this role you will maintain and develop BI and analytics solutions used by Argus customers around the world. Individual responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, the following:  Building data visualizations using Power BI and Microsoft Azure services Developing data models to support reporting and analytics Developing pipelines needed to build and maintain data models Developing machine learning models to support predictive analytics Developing new ways of leveraging the Argus data asset through analysis and visualization Working with software engineering to embed visualizations into Argus SaaS products Collaborating with software and product development to create new product features Being part of an energetic and fast-moving team with a passion for innovation Minimum requirements:  5-7+ years of experience in a data analysis environment Experience building data visualizations using Power BI or similar tools Experience developing visualizations that are embedded into SaaS products Experience working the Azure services for data, serverless computing, and machine learning Experience using Python or a similar tool to develop machine learning models and pipelines Strong SQL skills, and ability to write and optimize complex queries Excellent oral and written communication skills A bachelor’s degree in mathematics, engineering, physics, or a related field Nice to Have Experience building machine learning models to support a commercial analytics application Data engineering, database administration, software engineering, or similar experience Exposure to big data platforms Experience working with aviation data or within the aviation industry Why Chose ARGUS?  Full time benefits will include: 401K Match, Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance, Voluntary Coverages, Paid Short Term Disability, Paid Vacation and Holidays, Flexible Schedules, Wellness Initiatives, Gym Reimbursement, Competitive Salary with a Friendly Casual Atmosphere. The salary range for this position will be 70-130K per year based on skillset and years of experience. ARGUS  is an equal opportunity employer. Job Type: Full-time
