Evolytics is evolving analytics by inspiring people to use data in ways that make a difference in the world. With a focus on optimizing consumer experiences and strengthening business growth, Evolytics works with world-class brands to support data initiatives that span the data lifecycle. Capabilities include: Measurement Strategy & Planning, Data Audits, Analytics Implementation Services, Data Engineering, Reporting & Analysis, Data Visualization, Testing & Optimization, Data Science, and Customized Training.  As a Data Scientist at Evolytics, you will collaborate with client teams to help enterprise organizations improve their marketing, products, and processes. You’ll have the opportunity to be a thought leader in the analytics industry and to work on cutting edge projects where you’re building innovative, end-to-end solutions alongside a team.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING  Listening to client business problems and recommending an analysis method  Cleanse and prepare large datasets for analysis  Conduct statistical analysis, including regression, decision tree, cluster analysis, t-test, correlation, etc.  Develop and refine machine learning models  Interpret analysis findings, focusing on business implications and recommended optimizations and next steps  Organize and present analysis approach and findings to clients, including both statistically minded analytics audiences as well as non-statistical audiences  Collaborate with data engineers to automate data pipelines  Document results and process for internal and client knowledgebases   WHAT EXPERIENCE WOULD WE LIKE TO SEE?  BS/MS degree in marketing, statistics, computer science, behavioral science or a related field  2+ years' experience with conducting data analysis on large data sets, via Python, R, SQL, SAS, Alteryx, or other statistical analysis tools  2+ years' experience communicating statistical results in a business setting  Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking  Legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future   OTHER EXPERIENCE THAT IS HELPFUL, BUT NOT REQUIRED  Creating and preparing databases and tables for predictive modeling and data science applications  Experience in big data environments such as AWS and Hive   CULTURE What’s it like to work at Evolytics? It’s being challenged by your analytics-passionate co-workers to push the envelope. It’s constantly learning and sharpening your skill set. It’s working toward that next “aha” moment with a client when you deliver a fantastic data-derived golden nugget. It’s having a blast with the team while you perfect your craft and get to do work you love.  Perks:  Relaxed work environment: casual dress code, pool/ping pong table, treadmill desks  Collaboration-oriented office space with plenty of room for working sessions or potlucks  Awesome team building events like a day at the Royals game or mini-golf with margaritas  Food…weekly lunches, daily snacks, fruits, beverages, unlimited coffee  Learning opportunities: company-provided training, conferences and super-smart co-workers   BENEFITS  Competitive Benefits Package including Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance  Great Compensation Package with Paid Time Off, Performance Bonuses and IRA Matching Contributions  Opportunity to work alongside amazingly fun people who are passionate about delivering awesome in everything they do.   Consideration will be given to qualified candidates with varying levels of experience, with compensation commensurate with experience.  AWARDS  Fortune’s Best Small and Medium Workplaces in 2020: #25 in US  Honored for Best Places to Work in 2020 by the Kansas City Business Journal  Recognized as a Great Place to Work in 2020  Voted Coolest Office Space (Small Business) by the Kansas City Business Journal  Named Top Analytics Agency by the Digital Analytics Association in 2018 and again in 2020   Awesome people make powerful teams. Let’s do great things together!

Data Scientist / Engineer (Remote)  LightingNewYork.com | Remote  At Lighting New York, we work to acquire raving fans by retaining excellent team members who are dedicated to the culture and growth of the organization and strive to provide the best in class customer experience, home goods product selection and value. We're one of the fastest growing businesses in our industry and we're looking for A+ team members to help us continue that growth.  If the idea of scripting SQL data using validation tables matched up with 3rd party data to generate an XML data feed triggered by delta variations to ensure accurate and timely information sharing even makes sense to you - then we should talk!  As an eCommerce business that also has an expansive Sales team, we collect a lot of data. The problem, of course, is what to do with it! Hopefully, that's where you come in. We collect data in a variety of ways - like SQL databases, XML feeds, and through third parties (like Google Analytics), and we know that we can do powerful things with it - we just need someone to help us put it all together.  This role will act as a data scientist alongside our application developers to create business-critical feeds, integrations, and a repository of the single source of truth for the business. You should be a strong technologist, with tools like python and SQL management in your background while also demonstrating the ability to comprehend and communicate how the data sources interact.  This position can be a fully-remote role. Lighting New York is headquartered in Selinsgrove, PA (about 45 minutes north of Harrisburg) and we'd love to have you onsite periodically, but it's more important to us to find the right person to succeed in this role - whether you are remote or local. If you have the experience and drive to take this fun, exciting company to the next level - we'd like to talk!   Some Requirements for the role:  Experience and broad understanding of databases, including SQL Server. Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) Experience working with and creating data architectures. General understanding of 3rd party hosted (SAAS) data platforms like Snowflake, Splunk, Redshift, or others. An innate sense of urgency and competitiveness with a drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. Excellent oral and written communication skills for coordinating across teams. Excellent communicator & creative thinker, with an ability to use both data & intuition to inform decisions. Experience using reporting and/or visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau. eCommerce industry experience preferred Very skilled with Microsoft Excel Strong organizational and project management skills, coupled with attention to detail. You have the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment Must be an enthusiastic self-starter, responsive to instruction and eager to learn more while having a knack for being innovative and inquisitive, while remaining practical and decisive  You play well with others.   ABOUT LIGHTING NEW YORK  LightingNewYork.com is one of the fastest growing online lighting retailers in the US and a Pennsylvania “Best Place to Work” for the last 3 years. Located in Central Pennsylvania, our expanding team works hard to always move forward, but we don't underestimate the value of having some fun. We pride ourselves on being different from our competition by making an effort to “wow” every person we come in contact with in our daily business endeavors. We work collaboratively with over 150 different vendors and strive to bring a personal and expert-driven experience to every one of our customers. As such, we look for team members that are adventurous, self-motivated, and enjoy being a part of this pursuit.

Job Title Business Intelligence Engineer/Data Scientist-Remote * About Us* The food service industry is rapidly digitizing, creating a wave of change driving career opportunities for those with an entrepreneurial mindset, a strong work ethic, and the willingness to adapt and grow. iFoodDS offers a food safety, traceability and quality platform for use across the global food supply chain (growers, harvesters, packers/shippers, processors, distributors, grocery retailers and foodservice providers). Our market is huge ($10B+), international and growing. We are at the cutting edge of a major shift in how the agricultural industry uses technology—moving from analog processes to digital systems, data analytics and Artificial Intelligence. iFoodDS enables transparency across the supply chain, and helps our customers gain process efficiencies, maintain regulatory compliance, and send safer, wholesome food to market. Who We are Looking For iFoodDS is expanding its team and seeking a business intelligence engineer / data scientist to support the development and delivery of dashboards and reports as well as perform data analysis and regressions for predictive analysis for the iFoodDS SaaS food safety, traceability and quality management platform. We are looking for someone who has experience working directly with customers to understand their needs and the creativity to deliver innovative data analytics solutions to meet those needs and continue to differentiate iFoodDS in the market. * Responsibilities* Coordinate with customers to determine business data reporting and analytics requirements and delivery them to meet customer needs. Maintain, enhance and create external and customer-facing reports and dashboards used for food safety, quality management and traceability in Tableau. Perform statistical analysis using techniques including regression analysis, time series, multivariate, A/B, cohort, end-to-end/funnel, and other methods. Work with database administrators and developers to maintain and deliver the data warehouse to support business intelligence, reporting and analytics. Assist in data modelling, ETL and integration activities in data warehouse. Train customers, sales and support engineers in data reporting and analytical utilization. Anticipate changes and future trends and implement enhancements and modifications to optimize business intelligence value and processes. Support the development of business intelligence standards to meet business goals and anticipated growth. Effectively and comfortably interact with upper management. Operate under minimal supervision, with wide latitude for independent judgment to improve customer analytics. Qualifications Deep experience with Tableau and general familiarity with other data analysis and visualization tools. Knowledgeable in data modeling and warehousing with experience in SQL (postgres, mySQL, SQL Server) and as well as ETL tools such Pentaho as nice to have. Familiarity or interest in food supply chain efficiency, quality management and traceability. Good working knowledge of SaaS and enterprise IT environments, particularly around enterprise data security, ERP systems, and supply chain management Strong presentation and communications skills. Ability to engage in technical sales and customer implementation activities. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work independently and within the constructs of a team environment Education & Work Experience 3+ years of experience in business intelligence engineering and/or data science. Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, busines intelligence or another comparable technical field. A master’s degree is preferred. Enterprise SaaS software company experience a plus Knowledge or experience in the food supply chain, including retail grocery a plus Key Benefits Meaningful work Positive “Can Do” Company Culture Competitive Benefits Package to include Medical, Dental, Vision IRA Account Match Flexible Vacation Policy Job Type: Full-time

Join us as we revolutionize the hospital pharmacy landscape! Our mission is to wow customers with smart, elegant solutions that help healthcare providers increase efficiency, safety and visibility from manufacturer to bedside. Our 'vibe' is start-up, but we already have over 700 customers who are tracking medications using our proven solutions. If you have a knack for making complex things simple and an interest in the practical application of artificial intelligence and IoT technologies, we have a place for you! Kit Check is looking for a  Senior Data Scientist  to help us refine and grow our suite of healthcare data products to further the company's mission of "Medication Intelligence". Our hospital and pharmacy customers rely on us to keep their patients safe and their pharmacies running smoothly while delighting them with every release. By streamlining their pharmacy's daily routines with our RFID inventory management solution and reducing risk and enhancing their compliance with our controlled substance tracking platform, we're committed to improving medication management for our nation's healthcare providers, and our data operations and products are the backbone of our offerings. The Opportunity The central Data team is charged with driving the success of data science and analytics efforts at Kit Check by providing actionable insights, running predictive models, and building a core data infrastructure. We partner with cross-functional peers through all stages: identifying initial RnD projects, building and refining existing models, analyzing the impact of our efforts, and highlighting improvement areas. Ultimately, the team’s work strengthens Kit check and helps us move toward our suite of Medication Intelligence products. This is a fully remote (virtual) position and is a part of the central Data team. You can expect to: Formulate and lead data-driven projects geared toward furthering our medication intelligence strategy. Produce and disseminate non-technical reports that detail the successes and limitations of each project. Suggest ways in which insights obtained might be used to inform business strategies. Partner with our product teams to achieve goals around existing controlled substances models predictions as well as data consumer experiences. Collate and clean data from various entities for use by Junior Data Scientists. Delegate to other Data Scientists, while monitoring the performance of newer Data Scientists and providing them with practical guidance. Selecting and employing advanced statistical procedures to obtain actionable insights. Cross-validate and test models to ensure their generalizability Prepare models for production including improving automation and standardizations. Stay informed about developments in Data Science and adjacent fields to ensure that outputs are always relevant. Play a lead role in proposing new predictive models through analysis of behavioral and transactional data. Transform raw data into meaningful and impactful analysis characterized by strong data governance, technique transparency, and quality documentation. Raise the skill level of the entire analytics team through the creation of outstanding work, mentorship, and the introduction of better practices, processes, and tools. Serve as a liaison between engineering, data, and non-technical audiences. This includes critiquing requirements, informing roadmaps, assessing risk, and presenting during customer-facing meetings.  About you: Qualified with a degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or similar. Extensive professional experience at a minimum of two companies as a data scientist. Proficiency in Python, including Jupyter notebooks, pandas, Scikit-learn, NumPy, SCIpy. Master-level understanding of SQL. Outstanding team leadership and mentorship abilities. Demonstrable history of conceiving and overseeing data-centered projects. Experience working with ETL tools, e.g. Stitch/DBT, data pipeline products, and MPP data warehouses like Redshift, Snowflake. Experience with Amazon Web Services. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to advocate technical solutions to fellow scientists, engineering teams, and business audiences to inform business decisions. Capacity to foster a healthy work environment that relies on teamwork between various data disciplines. Prior track record of guiding product teams to identify high-impact opportunities, set meaningful goals against key outcomes, and drive decisions Specializations in sophisticated analyses and regularly use statistical methods in your work. Ability to break complex problems into narratives that are concise, actionable to express your recommendations. Acted as a mentor, guiding others to make their own work better and more efficient Track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing trade-offs, and delivering results in a very dynamic environment  Nice to have: Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, statistics, information systems, economics, mathematics, or similar Multiple companies’ worth tenured experience working with large, complex datasets to create/optimize machine learning, predictive, forecasting, and/or optimization models. Deep experience with both supervised learning methods (linear and logistic regression, time-series modeling, generalized linear models, decision trees, etc.) and unsupervised learning methods (K-means, clustering, etc.). Experience with AWS Machine learning projects including Sagemaker.  What you'll get from us Opportunity to build a data team culture within the organization and to shape a data team that has built an industry-leading product. A strong voice in what we work on, how it works, and how we build it Trust in your sense of ownership, estimations, and design decisions A budget for training and career development Coworkers you'll learn from and who are looking to learn from you Opportunities to solve problems of scale, technical debt, and security to redefine what’s possible in medication intelligence  Our culture Kit Check’s culture is built on collaboration and innovation. There’s room to grow and opportunities to take initiative. You will partner with sharp, motivated teammates looking to disrupt a massive industry—and have fun while doing it. Interested? If helping us define new data-driven medication intelligence products as well as improving products that have a great track record with our customers sounds like the opportunity for you, we'd love to talk! This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States. Why Kit Check? We truly believe that where you work matters and we want happy employees. So join us on our mission – we intend to have a heck of a good time as we get there. Competitive salary Time off when you need it – unlimited vacation days! Generous insurance coverage 401k program with a company match Employee stock options Fun, collaborative culture! Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled

Our hundreds of data scientists leverage the best data assets and modeling methods to build consistent and comparable metrics of viewing behavior. We help the world’s biggest brands make better and faster media and marketing decisions. Experience working with ML models Data Engineering experience About This Role: You will be working in a cross-functional team of statisticians, data scientists, software developers, and data engineers. About You: You are knowledgeable about statistical and machine learning models and can explain them equally well to experts and laypersons. You comprehend complex problems quickly and are creative in finding solutions. You understand media measurement or are able to quickly pick up domain knowledge on the job. You write production-quality code and enjoy operationalizing your solutions at scale. You’re able to shift gears quickly and adapt to changing circumstances. You have experience working with teams and maintaining velocity in complex projects. You see the big picture and enjoy digging into the details. Necessary Qualifications: Master’s degree in Statistics, Social Science, Operation Research, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or related fields with outstanding analytical expertise; 3+ years of experience; Proficient in Python, Spark, or Scala to develop sharable software with the appropriate technical documentation; Proficient in SQL and large-scale databases. job_Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries! At Nike, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Analytics is a competitive differentiator for Nike and is fundamentally changing how the company serves athletes and consumers around the world! The Nike Commercial Analytics team builds analytic-based solutions to manage marketplace and optimize the supply chain. Using big data, advanced analytics and state-of-the-art technology, the team strives to ensure that Nike gets the right product to the right place at the right time for the consumers.  WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR  We are looking for an experienced Expert Data Scientist to join the Advanced Analytics team within Commercial Analytics serving Global Sourcing & Manufacturing (GSM). You will be part of a multi-functional agile squad and will provide technical leadership in building predictive and prescriptive analytic solutions to support Nike’s Sourcing and Manufcturing strategies. The team develops analytical solutions across the funactional areas of GSM which include: Sourcing, Costing, Delivery, Product Integrity, Air MI, Sustainability, Materials, Manufacturing and Engineering.  The candidate needs to be an excellent problem solver and have extensive hands-on analytics experience in business analytics, supply chain modeling, and optimization. You have deep understanding of complex technical and business issues. You excel at distilling business complexity and translating requirements into testable hypotheses and usable prototypes. You know how to break down the work, amplify each squad member’s strength and identify/mitigate risks. You help push the boundary of what’s possible and challenge your team to strive for excellence and deliver value.  WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON  If this is you, you will be part of the GSM Advanced Analytics squad that delivers data science / operations research products to support Nike’s critical global Sourcing and Planning decisions, across multi-seasons, product engines, capabilities, materials and performance management. You will have opportunities to influence product direction, guide standard methodologies in data science and engineering, and lead technical projects from inception to completion. Specifically, you will:  Work with the squad through assessment of business requirements, data constraints, and pros/cons of alternative analytics techniques to determine the best solution approach. Facilitate the planning, scheduling and value measurement of the work to meet timeline targets and success criteria.  Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of production grade data science and operation research models to determine optimal level of factory utilization, capacity, costs, lead times, and reduction of un-planned.  Help shape Nike’s analytical platforms and products by identifying foundational data science capabilities and creating reusable analytical components.  Support the adoption of analytic products through effective storytelling and collaboration with key partners.  Mentor and coach other team members; continue to expand knowledge of data science/analytics trends.  WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH  You will work with the Director of Advanced Analytics and serve as a technical leader in the GSM Advanced analytics squad, which includes other data scientists (and data engineers partners). You will collaborate across our broader organization with business teams in Global Sourcing & Manufacturing, Demand and Supply Management as well as other data, analytics and technology functions at Nike.  WHAT YOU BRING  Advanced quantitative degree (preferably Operations Research, Management Science, or Industrial and Systems Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics) and at least 7 years of relevant industry experience or Bachelor’s degree with 10-12 years of relevant experience.  Demonstrated understanding of analytical solutions applied to Supply Chain management and optimization. In-depth knowledge of supply chain management, supply planning, sourcing, manufacturing and preferred past consulting experience.  Highly proficient in optimization tools (such as AIMMS, CPLEX, Gurobi, AnyLogic, and Google OR Tools) and programming languages (particularly Python and SQL).  Experience in leading the development of simulation, optimization, and what-if scenario planning tools and managing a team through all stages of Data Science/Analytics lifecycle.  Familiarity with the wide range of data science/analytics software tools (e.g. Jupyter Notebook, SQL consoles, Hadoop, Spark) and cloud computing platforms (e.g. Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform).  Familiarity with the Agile development process and demonstrable ability to prepare a project plan, communicate the plan to the team and break the work down to trackable tasks.  Proven track record of effectively influencing and collaborating with multi-functional partners to identify new opportunities, solve complex business problems and build impactful analytics solutions.  Good communication skills and experience in conveying complex information in easy-to-understand language.  Open to remote work, except cannot work in Colorado, South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate. We also want to improve our world, and make impact/humanitarian investments in developing countries, helping local communities.  Our team covers multiple disciplines from Computer Science and Mathematics to Econometrics and Statistics, with backgrounds ranging from years in the industry to current students. We work remote, cover multiple time zones, and love what we do. The Double River culture is all about trust, being curious, and working together.  We are looking for a machine learning engineer to test, develop, and maintain machine learning models to inform our quantitative investing. The work can be done in conjunction with school or another job/internship. The workload will be about 10-20 hours a week, and can be done in a balanced manner over each week. Statistician We’ve been proudly cloud-based and work-from-home since 2010, in the online education industry since 2006, and consider ourselves to be pioneers in our industry. Our primary focus is academic consulting for doctoral-level clients, and due to growth in our sector, we are looking for teammates to join us for the long term. This is a fully remote, highly flexible position. Many of our statisticians also work as adjunct professors and appreciate the flexibility the position offers for family, travel, or creative endeavors. The main responsibility will be to support our clients with larger, more complex statistical analyses. All applicants will need to be comfortable designing and drafting a valid statistical methodology (specifying the sample, population, instrumentation, data collection and analysis procedures, etc.), running the analyses using standard stats packages, and drafting and interpreting the results. All deliverables need to be in a presentable, professional format. Applicants must have a strong applied mathematics or statistics background; proficiency in applied statistics and hypothesis testing is required. Applicants must be familiar with SPSS and preferably also with R, SAS and/or STATA. We do not provide training for this position, and as such, any applicant should have high-level statistical consulting experience in a professional environment. Requirements:  Applicants must possess a meticulous nature and an extremely high attention to detail, as well as excellent command of the English Language. All statisticians must have or be actively pursuing graduate degrees in statistics, applied math, data analytics, or a similar field as well as relevant experience. To apply: Please email recruiting@precisionconsultingcompany.com with a recently updated resume and a cover letter explaining your interest in the Statistician position.

You are curious and driven to collect, analyze and interpret data that will be used to inform product decisions. VSCO is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to take our data practice to the next level. You will take a leading role in defining how we leverage data at VSCO, scope out projects, propose approaches, and drive them to completion. JOB DESCRIPTION At Levi Strauss & Co, we are revolutionizing the apparel business and redefining the way denim is made. We are taking one of the world’s most iconic brands into the next century: from creating machine learning-powered denim finishes to using block-chain for our factory workers’ wellbeing, to building algorithms to better meet the needs of our consumers and optimize our supply chain. Be a pioneer in the fashion industry by joining our global merchandise planning data science team, where you will have the chance to build exciting solutions that will impact our business and at the same time be part of a bigger, across-continents, data science community. As a Sr. Data Scientist, you will be instrumental in developing models that address specific business needs while being innovative and bringing cutting-edge research into production. About the job: The job responsibilities span over our entire lifecycle of data products and will include: Partner with stakeholders across the Global planning organization and own multiple roadmap workstreams to enable us to use advanced ML and DL techniques to solve complex retail problems Independently lead strategically important and large projects with a significant impact on future capabilities and success of the business. Build complex predictive models using ML and DL techniques with production quality code and jointly own complex data science workflows with the Data Engineering team Mentor and grow junior members of the team in building the best of the class solutions on their roadmap items. Continuously scan the Data Science landscape for recent developments and opportunities to integrate new methodologies into the existing project portfolio. Ensure that the risks associated with projects are raised proactively to ensure all projects stay on track About You: 7+ years of prior experience in a business-focused Data Scientist role 7+ years of hands-on experience analyzing data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, building predictive models, and visualizing results. 6+ years of SQL development skills writing complex queries. 4+ years of experience with Python, R, Java, C++, Julia, or another widely used open-source programming language. 4+ years of experience deploying Machine Learning algorithms in a production environment. 4+ years’ experience in experience in Deep Learning engineering. 4+ years’ experience with distributed computing and data processing using tools like Kubernetes, Kafka, Spark & HIVE 4+ years of data visualization experience demonstrating ability to determine the appropriate visualization for a variety of data types and create compelling stories with data. (D3.js, R Shiny, Looker, Tableau or similar). Experience working with cloud environments: AWS and/or Azure and/or GCP cloud platforms. Experience in Reinforcement Machine Learning is a huge plus. Experience in the retail domain is a plus #LI-Remote/#LI-Hybrid EOE M/F/Disability/Vets LOCATION Remote - USA FULL TIME/PART TIME Full time Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Company Description Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you. At Shopify, we build products that help entrepreneurs around the world start and grow their business. We’re the world’s fastest growing commerce platform with millions of merchants in more than 175 different countries, with solutions from point-of-sale and online commerce to financial, shipping logistics and marketing.   Job Description Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. Our Data Scientists focus on pushing products and the business forward, with a focus on solving important problems rather than specific tools. We are looking for talented data scientists to help us better understand our merchants and buyers so we can help them on their journey. Responsibilities: Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains Partner closely with product, engineering and other business leaders to influence product and program decisions with data Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build instrumentation and define dimensional models, tables or schemas that support business processes Build actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products Influence leadership to drive more data-informed decisions Define and advance best practices within data science and product teams   Qualifications  4-6 years of commercial experience as a Data Scientist solving high impact business problems Extensive experience with Python and software engineering fundamentals Experience with applied statistics and quantitative modelling (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed) Demonstrated ability to translate analytical insights into clear recommendations and effectively communicate them to technical and non-technical stakeholders Curiosity about the problem domain and an analytical approach Strong sense of ownership and growth mindset Experience with one or more: Deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques Expertise with statistical techniques and their applications in business Masterful data storytelling and strategic thinking Deep understanding of dimensional modelling and scaling ETL pipelines Experience launching productionized machine learning models at scale Extensive domain experience in e-commerce, marketing or SaaS Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role. At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard.  Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at  our Sustainability Reports  to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet. #LI-REMOTE

TEOCO’s Audit team is seeking a smart, self-motivated, and collaborative candidate. This is a great opportunity to gain or build upon experience in consulting, developing or enhancing a foundation of telecom knowledge and learning advanced software tools.  RESPONSIBILITIES  Based on direction from management, auditor will analyze client invoice data and pinpoint vendor overbillings or under billings by applying general audit principals such as pattern recognition, data filtering, and cross referencing multiple data sources  The auditor will be required to analyze contracts, applicable tariffs, Interconnection Agreements, and research other sources of potential data. Other source data may include industry databases such as LERG (Local Exchange Routing Guide) and NECA (National Exchange Carrier Association), client provisioning systems, internal TEOCO software tools such as BillTrak, SONAR, and NEO, and external software tools such as COFinder and Google Earth  Employee will leverage some or all of the following software tools as part of daily activities: MS Excel, SQL, MS Access, Python, R, Alteryx and Business Objects  Employee will load potential overbillings or under billings in a spreadsheet format into TEOCO’s web-based Claim Center application, adding a written description of the issue and any necessary supporting information  Employee will analyze any responses from vendors and provide on-going support to the reconciliation team to help resolve issues on behalf of the client with the vendor.  Employee may be called, on occasion, to participate in calls with clients to explain issues or to demonstrate and train clients on how issues were identified  EDUCATION & REQUIREMENTS  Experience with MS Outlook, MS Excel, & MS Word. Demonstrated Analytical/Problem Solving Skills and Communication Skills  2 + years of experience working in telecom environment is preferred  Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Math or Statistics

job_Description: Come join our award winning team! See What Is Possible.... The Froedtert & the Medical College of Wisconsin regional health network is a partnership between Froedtert Health and the Medical College of Wisconsin supporting a shared mission of patient care, innovation, medical research and education. Our health network operates eastern Wisconsin's only academic medical center and adult Level I Trauma Center at Froedtert Hospital, Milwaukee, an internationally recognized training and research center engaged in thousands of clinical trials and studies. The Froedtert & MCW health network, which includes five hospitals, more than 1,700 physicians and nearly 40 health centers and clinics, draws patients from throughout the Midwest and the nation.  Froedtert Health has been widely recognized for our dedication to our staff, providing a work environment full of encouragement, innovation, collaboration and respect. Our best-in-class wellness program has earned us recognition in the  Milwaukee Business Journal  as a Healthiest Employer and a Gold Well Workplace award from the Wellness Council of America. We invite you to review the job posting below. If you meet the requirements and qualifications for this opportunity, you are encouraged to apply. Thank you for considering a career with Froedtert Health! Location: REMOTE US:WI:MENOMONEE FALLS at our WOODLAND PRIME 400 facility. FTE: 1.000000 *1.0 FTE is Full-Time, any position less than 1.0 FTE is Part-Time, and .001 FTE is Optional Part-Time* *Positions with an "FTE" (full time equivalency) of .8 - 1.0 are eligible for full-time medical, dental and vision benefits. Positions with an "FTE" of .5 - .799 are eligible for part-time pro-rated medical, dental and vision benefits* Shift: REMOTE flexible 1st shift 7am to 5 pm Summary: Responsible for creating an environment of data information availability, consistency, and clarity to support the business performance and activity management of internal customers. Promotes data literacy, prioritizes requests, maintains timelines, and helps to ensure the accuracy and validity of data. Other duties as assigned. Responsibilities: A minimum of 5 years of directly related experience with analytically challenging projects in IT or healthcare analytics that includes programming (SQL or comparable) and reporting design (Business Objects, Crystal Reports MicroStrategy, Microsoft Analytic Services, SAS, SSIS, MS SQL Reporting Server, McKesson, etc.) is required. Experience in a customer facing role (internal or external) is required. Experience developing functional and technical specifications is required. Project Management experience is required. 10 years of directly related experience is preferred. Health care reporting experience is highly preferred. Knowledge of computer principles at a level normally acquired through completion of a Bachelors degree in a relevant technology field or acquired through a combination of education and experience is required. Bachelors degree in Finance, Analytics, Informatics, Computer Science, Information Technology, Healthcare Administration, or Business is preferred. Epic Systems Reporting Training and/or Certification is preferred. Other Information: Advanced knowledge in one or more of the following: quantitative analysis, financial analysis, budget analysis, information systems, project management, organizational development or new business development. Advanced proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel. Working knowledge of datamarts and data warehouse. Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of individuals including executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Ability to conceptualize, document, and communicate solutions to meet business objectives. Demonstrated ability to understanding and interpret complex mathematical models /concepts healthcare data and effectively present highly sophisticated analysis and findings. Detail oriented with the ability to synthesize information from multiple sources. Demonstrates excellent follow-up skills and the ability to take initiative as well as a proactive problem solving approach. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to listen and convey messages in a clear, concise, and empathetic manner using the appropriate communication medium. Team oriented with good interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with peers and customers. Comfortable providing input and alternate views in a healthy, constructive way. THIS IS US  TIER Mobility is Europe's leading shared micro-mobility provider, with a mission to Change Mobility for Good. By providing people e-scooters, e-bikes, e-mopeds and other sustainable modes of transport, TIER helps cities to reduce their dependence on cars and move towards a zero-emission future. Founded in 2018, TIER employs more than 1,000 people and operates in 150+ cities across 16 countries in Europe and the Middle East.  With a $2 billion valuation, TIER has raised a total of $660 million in equity and debt funding to date, backed by prestigious investors like SoftBank Vision Fund 2, Mubadala Capital, Northzone, and Goodwater Capital.  TIER is at the forefront of the sustainable transport revolution in one of the fastest growing industries. We’d love for you to join the ride.   Permanent employee, Full-time - REMOTE*  We offer remote work from the locations below, plus Greece & Spain:  https://www.tier.app/en/where-to-find-us/  GET AN IMPRESSION OF THE TEAM  We are a diverse team of Data Engineers, Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists helping TIER advance in all things data. We are from 10 different nations and like to geek out on different data stacks and technologies. We strive to build great data infrastructure and enable teams across TIER to take data-informed decisions  THE ROLE AND YOUR IMPACT AT TIER   You will be the go-to expert on all forms of experimentation within Consumer Analytics, providing expert advice to other data scientists/analysts & Product teams on end-to-end experiment delivery.  Working closely with other data scientists, analysts & engineers to develop & execute a roadmap to bring large scale, best-in-class experimentation into production.  Your work will mainly focus on developing a best-in-class experimentation process & framework which will serve as the bedrock of our testing strategy, driving a common approach across all Consumer teams & empowering all teams to scale up their experimentation plans.  Your work will ultimately seek to improve the accuracy & validity, as well as the speed of experiments at Tier, enabling teams to make faster, more scientifically rigorous decisions.  You will collaborate closely with product teams & analysts to develop cohesive, iterative experiment roadmaps.  You act as a data champion at Tier, evangelising the use of data and proactively identifying opportunities to increase data literacy and engagement across the organisation.   YOU’LL FIT GREAT WITH THESE SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS   3+ years as Data Scientist/Analyst planning, delivering & analysing experiments within a commercial context. Experience running full stack experiments across multiple platforms a big plus.  Experience building or developing an experimentation process & framework.  Bachelors or Masters in a statistics, mathematics or a scientific discipline involving the heavy use of statistical methods for experiment analysis. PhD in any of these fields is a big plus.  Deep understanding of experimental methods and statistics. Experience with causal inference & other econometric techniques a big plus.  Experience working with large scale datasets in a commercial context.  Expert in Python/R for statistical analysis.  Strong SQL skills for data extraction & analysis.  You can communicate findings in a succinct and clear manner to a wide variety of stakeholders so that they can draw conclusions quickly and make rapid decisions.  You have excellent commercial awareness and can prioritise working on problems with the highest business impact   THIS MAY INSPIRE YOU   Join us at the forefront of one of the most exciting and rapidly moving industries  We’re agile, we’re growing and so will you! At TIER, there’s space for exponential professional development and room to make a huge impact on the business going forward  Being part of the team means you’re part of its success. Our ESOP program gives you an opportunity to have a share in the company – nothing like invested interest!  We appreciate your talent and support your growth with an annual development budget  Surf your city with free rides on our e-scooters and e-mopeds  Diversity and inclusivity is super important to us, so enjoy initiatives and programs such as #WomenofTIER  Expect company onboarding and team events with international colleagues from all over the world  Benefit from flexible hours and our work from home policy  Enjoy amazing views at our centrally located office at Potsdamer Platz, with a variety of different restaurants and great transport connections   We actively encourage a diverse and inclusive environment that fosters each employee’s individuality at TIER. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for your application, regardless to your nationality, ethnic or national origin, skin color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation or gender identity. Come as you are and join our ride!  In case you are living with disabilities, chronic illness or neurodiversity please inform us, to provide you with the proper assistance in the application process.  If we could spark your interest and you want to change mobility for good with us, apply now and let us know why you’re the one for the job! We encourage everyone to apply and grow with us. Even if you may not tick all the boxes of the requirements, we are happy to hear about the value you can add to the team. We are all learners!  We are looking forward to your application!

We are Farmers!  Work with a team of diverse professionals at Farmers, create and deploy game changing data science across the enterprise and all lines of business and products. The position will challenge your strategic, interpersonal and tactical capabilities. You will not only have the opportunity to interact with leadership across the company, you will gain access to enterprise data and have the opportunity to develop cross-functional models, interactive risk dashboards, and perform complex and ad hoc analysis. Farmers Insurance also offers extensive training opportunities, opportunities to develop within the individual department and expand outside of the department, so start your career at Farmers today!  Job Summary  Provides data modeling services (exploratory and predictive modeling) for line(s) of business and/or shared service functions. Works on end to end solutions as an individual contributor and as part of the project team, starting with partnering with business subject matter experts to identify project opportunities and clarify modeling requirements. Conceives and designs complex and innovative analytic models both that include traditional and contemporary data mining technologies, applied to both structured and unstructured data sets. Responsible for pulling and cleaning datasets, building and testing the models, and presenting results to internal teams and business leaders to demonstrate the business value of each project.   This is a remote position!  Essential Job Functions  Leads the design, build and test/validate process for quantitative models (descriptive, predictive, optimization/simulation and others) built using a variety of modeling techniques.  Models are used to predict activities or events within the lines of business such as fraud, premium leakage, internal audit issue impact, etc.  The modeling results could be presented to end users as reports, scorecards, dashboards, web applications or be implemented directly into the line of business workflow with an automated process.  Partners with business subject matter experts to identify project opportunities and clarify modeling requirements, including understanding who will use the potential solution and how it fits into the business process.  Presents modeling results to business leaders and discusses interpretation and application of using the model. Performs research and development on new modeling algorithms, modeling concepts or technical tools to find applicability to Farmers projects.  Presents results to the senior leadership team and recommends whether researched items should be added to the Analytics toolkit.  Leads team meetings, knowledge sharing and individual learning activities  Perform other job duties as assigned.  Physical Actions  Sits or stands for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Occasionally reaches overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Occasionally moves, lifts, carries, and places objects and supplies weighing 0-10 pounds without assistance. Listens to, interprets, and differentiates auditory information (e.g. others speaking) at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Visually verifies and reads information. Visually locates material, resources and other objects. Ability to operate a computer for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Physical dexterity sufficient to use hands, arms, and shoulders repetitively to operate keyboard and other office equipment up to a full work shift. Physical Environment  This position operates in an open office working environment which will include normal and customary distractions, noise, and interruptions. Education Requirements  High school diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree preferred. Masters degree in statistics, operations research or other quantitative analytical field preferred. Experience Requirements  5-7 years as Data Scientist or related technical role in a delivery oriented environment required. Experience within the insurance industry and insurance data preferred. Special Skill Requirement  Benefits  Farmers offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, qualifications and location  CO Only: The pay range for this job being performed in CO would be $102,400-$136,500  Bonus Opportunity (based on Company and Individual Performance)  401(k)  Medical  Dental  Vision  Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts  Life Insurance  Paid Time Off  Paid Parental Leave  Tuition Assistance   Job Location(s): US - RW - Remote Work - Farmers

job_title: Sr Data Scientist, Fraud - Open to remote work, except the following locations: CO, SD, VT, and WV
job_Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. Who we are looking for We are looking for a Senior Fraud Data Scientist to join the Onboarding & Profile Management Data Science Team. You will work closely with Digital Loss Prevention (DLP) in their goal to provide a seamless and frictionless online experience for consumers while mitigating fraudulent activity. This team focuses on using data to make decisions through a well-blended approach using machine learning algorithms and human intelligence. As a Fraud Data Scientist, you will be working with Nike's 3rd party fraud partners to facilitate the effective use of data in building out ML models, performing user behavior analysis, developing fraud rules and other techniques to identify and stop fraud in real time on Nike.com and other Nike digital properties (SNKRS, NRC, NTC). You will also be developing Nike's fraud data strategy including the buildout of critical data ingestion pipelines and ETL processes, as well as developing a data governance strategy. You will need strong project management skills and cross-functional experience to autonomously drive projects from beginning to end. What you will work on Key responsibilities will include owning data driven fraud prevention and detection strategies. You will apply knowledge of advanced algorithms and technologies to deliver better predictions and/or intelligent automation that enables smarter business decisions, improved customer experience, and drives productivity.  In addition, applying strong communication and story-telling skills to summarize statistical/algorithmic findings, draw business conclusions, and present significant insights in a way that resonates with business/groups is an integral component of the role. Who you will work with You will be a member of the Onboarding & Profile Management Data Science team where you will work cross-functionally with Nike’s Digital Loss Prevention team. The team is part of Nike’s Consumer Data Science team and Insights function. You will be a member of the broader data science team at Nike, and participate in our data science labs, study groups, and team activities, and attend conferences. This role reports to the Director of Onboarding & Profile Management, Data Science. You will inspire a small team of analytical specialists from the front, in everything you do. Your findings will empower the change needed for fraud as a whole to push forward whilst also supporting the operational arm of the fraud mitigation function. The ideal candidate will work closely with our geography teammates to ensure that we are all learning, growing and improving together!  What you bring Demonstrated experience defining and delivering effective machine learning and/or statistical models to serve business needs.  Experience developing models for production scale highly desirable.  Strong data wrangling and coding skills, with experience working in SQL, Python and Amazon AWS. Working knowledge of Spark is a plus.  Expertise in e-commerce is highly desired.  Experience in fraud/risk highly desired, minimum five years preferred.  Superb communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively cross-functionally required.  Experience presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences. A history of publications or presentations at conferences is a plus.  Project management/implementation experience including gathering business requirements, UTA, change management.  Product and entrepreneurial spirit. Comfort with working in new spaces, experience in proactively finding opportunities to drive relevant change.  Deep knowledge in data science, for example from a background in computer science, statistics, applied math, physics, or other quantitative field. Masters or PhD preferred.   Open to remote work, except cannot work in Colorado, South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.   Nike requires all applicants for this position to be vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of hire. As an equal opportunity employer, Nike will make accommodations to individuals who cannot be vaccinated in accordance with applicable law. NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

The Challenge: Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data. We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to improve geospatial analysis. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll develop data collection tools, data visualizations and dashboards, algorithms and scripts to process data or conduct predictive analytics leveraging geospatial tools, machine learning or other approaches. This is an opportunity to join a leading-edge, growing company while developing techniques and experience to improve the mission outcomes of our multiple clients. Join us as we turn data into knowledge. This position is open to remote delivery anywhere within the U.S., to include the District of Columbia. Empower change with us. You Have: 3+ years of experience with data collection, data processing, data visualization, data analytics, or data science approaches and tools, including in an academic, professional, or research environment Experience with one or more scripting or scientific languages, including Python, R, C++, or Java Experience with data management, data cleansing, analytic tool development, graph analytics, or decision support analytics Experience with version control tools, including GitHub and Git Ability to obtain a security clearance Bachelor's degree Nice If You Have: 4+ years of experience with applying machine learning techniques and the key parameters that affect their performance Experience with specialized geospatial software tools, including ESRI, ArcGIS, or Google Earth and geospatial data Experience with Microsoft Excel, Access, SharePoint, SQL, or other tools to manage data or databases Experience in working with a wide range of predictive and decision models and tools for developing models Experience with developing experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, using strong baselines, and determining cause and effect relationships accurately Experience with interactive dashboard development technologies Knowledge of statistical measures, including confidence intervals and the significance of error measurements, mathematical modeling techniques, optimization approaches, or machine learning algorithm development Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills Master's degree in Data Science, Geospatial Science, Applied Mathematics, CS, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, or Operations Research preferred; Doctorate degree in Data Science, Geospatial Science, Applied Mathematics, CS, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, or Operations Research a plus Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Compensation: The proposed salary range for this position in Colorado is $90,000 to $110,000. Final salary will be determined based on various factors. At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choice, and support your total well-being. Our comprehensive benefit offerings include healthcare, retirement plan, insurance programs, commuter program, employee assistance program, paid and unpaid leave programs, education assistance, and childcare benefits. Build Your Career:  At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the chance to: access online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition participate in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success. We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

job_title: Sr Data Analyst - Store Operations (Full Time Remote OR Hybrid)
job_Description: Store Operations, Process Operations Right on pace with Target’s distinctive retail brand, Target Store Operations is continuing to transform the way it operates. Here, your work directly supports the store mission to be the guest favorite through successfully developing and communicating the processes for operations, style and experience, new structures, new operating models and new technology, and utilizing workforce management activities for our 1,800+ locations nationwide. Store Operations manages and enhances the informational resources for researching and resolving operational issues, while guiding and communicating with the field team and leaders who use them. Are you a customer service enthusiast who can actively listen to many points of view and then visualize how they’ll perform when operationalized in a store? Are you happy to partner with leaders as well as field team members who are often the experts on how well a process is working? Can you creatively envision more efficient processes and how they’ll deliver a better experience for guests and team members? Do you possess the innovative mindset to question the status quo, and the confidence to work under varying degrees of ambiguity and well-informed experimentation? Then you’ll have success on one of our dynamic teams. A role with  Process Operations  means a big opportunity to apply your logistics, supply chain and fulfillment experience to continuously improve the strategies that fuel behind-the-scenes processes like fulfillment, replenishment and inventory accuracy. Primary Function: As a Sr. Data Analyst, you’ll be part of a team of analysts supporting Stores through active exploration of data, technologies and the application of mathematical techniques that enables actionable business insights to include the development of metrics, reports and statistics. A very critical role you’ll play is sharing out these insights through training/communication opportunities with end users to gather feedback, apply learned insights and testing in partnership with business users. Along the way you’ll be applying best practice s  for data wrangling, analysis and visualization by sharing well documented solutions with others (clients, peers, etc.) while upskilling on new and emerging technologies with a continuous improvement mindset. In addition, active participation in team meetings and contributing to agile ceremonies. Principal Duties and Responsibilities: Actively exploring data for specific use cases Creating measurable insights from the data to be shared Developing metrics, reports, and statistics Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review Exploring statistical analysis that could be applied to the data Performing descriptive statistics including mean, variance, median, correlation Applies insights and testing in partnership with business users Active participant in team meetings Contribute in agile ceremonies Reporting/Working Relationships: Works directly with product owners, process owners, other analysts and engineers to gain insight and access to relevant data. Engages with product owners and users to deliver completed work. Active participant in Data and Analytics functions and training. Job Requirements: BA/BS in a quantitative degree – Math, Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science or equivalent work experience Experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, Java, Scala, etc. 3+ years relevant experience in reporting and data visualization Extensive exposure to: visualization, coding, business consulting, database architecture, data mining, statistical analysis, and collaboration with business partners Strong problem solving and analytical skills Ability to learn, use, and teach reporting tools Understand BI and Data dependencies Demonstrate Testing and Research design; apply the scientific method and experimental design; generate insight from observation data Stays current with new and evolving technologies via formal training and self-directed education This position may be considered for a Full-Time Remote or Hybrid work arrangement based on Target’s needs. A Hybrid work arrangement means the team members core role will be a blend of virtual and onsite at a Target location. A Full-Time Remote work arrangement means the team member worksfull-time from home oran alternatelocation that’s not   a Target location, does not have a desk at their primary HQ work location and may travel to HQ up to 4 times a year. Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at  1-800-440-0680  for additional information. When you can find a greater purpose in your work, your potential is limitless. That’s the mindset that drives our team at Homepoint, as we strive to support the American dream of financially healthy, happy homeownership. Homepoint is a rising star in the mortgage industry with a culture that encourages community, caring, and open communication. What makes our team special is our people-first philosophy, as we empower and encourage our associates to speak up, become innovators and make impactful changes – no matter what position they hold within the company. Homepoint is one of the fastest-growing mortgage lenders in the U.S. – already the third-largest wholesale lender and a Top-10 correspondent lender. Founded in 2015, we are headquartered in Ann Arbor, MI and offer positions throughout the nation – many of which are remote. Our team has grown to include more than 3,500 associates and we service more than 400,000 customers nationwide. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for an opportunity to grow and develop your career, then we have the perfect opportunity for you!  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: The Sr. Data Analyst will be responsible for data related support, data investigation, research, and data management to support development solutions for defined projects, working closely with the business and development teams. The Sr. Data Analyst will use current technologies to provide analysis to assist in developing advanced modern, scalable, SQL based solutions serving our business in the mortgage finance industry. This includes the data analysis, occasional development, and recommendations for design of client and partner integrated SQL technical solutions for both proprietary and purchased software.  Perform data analysis to assist in producing well-designed and developed solutions for on-time deployment based on list of requirements  Scrum/Agile experience required  Data Compliance related experience required  Data Licensing related experience required  Strong Knowledge of Mortgage Banking preferred.  Strong in data profiling  Agile/SCRUM experience required  Solid source-to-target mapping skills  Advanced SQL skills  Advanced MS Excel skills preferred  Python experience preferred  Strong knowledge in Mortgage Servicing, MSP preferred  Data Governance experience, specifically Collibra preferred  Collaborate with team members on complex projects  Perform extensive data validation/quality assurance analysis within large datasets  Troubleshoot and investigate data anomalies and issues along with working directly with the development team to follow through and resolve issues  Work with business analysts to clarify requirements  Translate business import and export needs into a maintainable integrations platform  Perform related duties as assigned by manager  Ensure adherence to corporate development and mortgage industry requirements  Maintain compliance with all company policies and procedures  We offer a competitive salary and bonus opportunity, together with an innovative and progressive approach to benefits. It is our goal to provide our associates an exciting, dynamic, desirable place to work. Our ambitious business plan and its success hinges on the ability to find great people and provide an environment that fully engages, retains, and leverages the potential of top talent. As such, Homepoint provides development opportunities to all our associates, with a curriculum geared towards providing an informed view of multiple career paths. We have an owner-operator approach and when Homepoint succeeds, so do our associates. Homepoint is a national multi-channel mortgage originator and servicer. We bring an innovative approach to lending, focusing on speed, quality, and consistency for our customers and partners. Uniquely, Homepoint retains most of our originated loans for in-house servicing, a cornerstone to our Customer for Life approach. Homepoint is an Equal Opportunity Employer. For more information, visit Homepoint.com

Lucid is a research technology (ResTech) platform that provides programmatic access to first-party data. With respondents in more than 100 countries, Lucid enables anyone, in any industry, to survey online audiences and get the answers they need. These answers reveal the sentiments, motivations, and behaviors of target demographics – data that can be used to build business strategies, measure the impact of digital advertising, publish research, and more. Founded in 2010, Lucid is headquartered in New Orleans, LA with offices throughout the US, Europe, and Asia. As a Senior Data Scientist at Lucid you will have the opportunity to collaborate with product and engineering teams to work on survey design and measurement, identity resolution, trust & safety and more. This includes product analyses, validation and establishing statistical methodology and modeling standards and development. The right candidate has the ability to independently research, develop and maintain products that align Lucid capabilities with market claims. This role is open to candidates living in the United States to work remotely or from one of our US-based office locations (New Orleans, Dallas, New York) The ideal candidate for this role will have 3-5+ years of hands-on professional data science experience #LI-Remote #LI-AV2  Responsibilites Lead research, discovery and development phase for new and existing products. The primary areas include: identity, outlier detection, survey design and measurements, conversions, feasibility and funnel optimization. Independently and confidently carry out project planning, development and maintenance - end to end with minimum or no supervision. Analyze large and diverse datasets to extract impactful insights that can drive product strategy. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test new and existing products - develop and maintain statistical modeling and methodologies. Ongoing evaluation and validation of both internal and external products to ensure Lucid’s success. Communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations that will resonate with a wide range of audiences.  Qualifications Must have minimum 3-5 years working experience in data science capacity. Must have a minimum Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Quantitative Sciences, Data Science, Operations Research or other quantitative fields. Ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large data sources independently. Deep understanding of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (e.g. properties of distributions, hypothesis testing, parametric/non-parametric tests, survey design, sampling theory, experimental design, regression/predictive modeling and more). Strong Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision-trees etc) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Must have working knowledge in application of statistical and modeling techniques. Comfortable in researching and learning new methods, tools and techniques. Must be able to independently and confidently carry out projects end to end with minimum or no supervision. Proficient in Python (as statistical and ML package tools). Proficient in SQL and working with large-scale databases.  Nice to have Experience in media measurement and digital attribution Experience in multivariate testing Experience in online survey methodologies Experience employing causal inference methods Experience in Identity graphs and fraud detection methodologies Experience working with big data technologies (e. g. Spark)  Lucid's Hiring Commitment   We understand that many candidates may not be perfectly qualified for a job posting. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable – and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is near the desired qualifications. We also know that diversity of background and thought can enhance problem-solving and encourage more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. At Lucid we foster a collaborative and inspiring workplace. We pride ourselves in doing this by recruiting, hiring and retaining diverse, passionate, and forward-thinking talent. Lucid is committed to and encourages an inclusive environment and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
